intro: Anisomeles malabarica var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered Malabar anise, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, branching stems and produces small, fragrant flowers that are predominantly white or pale yellow. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slight aromatic scent, while its roots are often used in traditional medicine. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and medicinal properties.
